summary: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 changed how U.S. corporations' international income is taxed. We reviewed the regulations Treasury and IRS issued on the new international provisions. Although Treasury and IRS generally complied with legal requirements for issuing regulations, we recommended ways to improve future regulations. For example, IRS should estimate the time and money business taxpayers have to spend on completing paperwork...
title: Tax Cuts and Jobs Act: Future Rulemaking Should Provide Greater Detail on Paperwork Burden and Economic Effects of International Business Provisions
